Action Description: Confirm natural gas service capacity for turbine generators
Notes_Comments: Contact Oklahoma Natural Gas (or local provider) to confirm pipeline capacity for 3,000-4,000 CFH peak demand (multiple turbines). Verify pressure (5-10 psig), meter sizing (6-8"), and interconnection timeline. Critical for generator fuel strategy decision - do we have the pressure, reliability, etc. to run turbines vs diesel? If insufficient capacity, must fall back to diesel-only or evaluate dual-fuel strategy.
Cost Impact: $100-300K interconnection

Action Description: Comprehensive utility interconnection study and grid power validation
Notes_Comments: PRIMARY QUESTION: Confirm grid power is available at the site (138 kV service from OG&E). Submit formal interconnection application for 15-20 MVA substation transformer. Validate interconnection agreement permits: (1) 12MW solar export capability during Phase 1-2 (Option A), (2) 6-8MW additional load for mobile edge computing (Option B). Identify required utility upgrades, costs, and timeline. Determine POI configuration (single behind-the-meter vs dual POI). Coordinate with Camelot Task 1 findings (substation hosting capacity, transmission line analysis). 6-18+ month lead time - START IMMEDIATELY. Waiting on input from Camelot on CHILL and HILL process for large load interconnection.
Cost Impact: $2-5M utility upgrade cost exposure + $50K-$150K study fees, plus potential $0-5M for Option B mobile compute

Action Description: Confirm environmental consultant will validate emissions/air permitting path
Notes_Comments: Make sure we can run nat gas, diesel gens or turbine as needed. Verify permitting timeline and requirements for chosen generator fuel strategy.

Action Description: BESS-as-UPS analysis: CapEx savings estimate
Notes_Comments: Finalizing recommendations in this area…
Cost Impact: Traditional 2N UPS selected: $26.3M total. No UPS savings, but project finance viable.

Action Description: Coordinate Camelot fiber study with Aaron's Google GCP outreach
Notes_Comments: Review Camelot Task 3 fiber design drawings (T&M basis) for routing to site when delivered. Aaron is contacting Google regarding GCP Dedicated Interconnect feasibility. Confirm diverse fiber routes, carrier availability, and physical diversity. Validate dark fiber connectivity to Google Pryor campus (~4 miles, <1ms latency target). Determine if separate telecom consultant needed.
Cost Impact: $200-400K fiber infrastructure

Action Description: BESS-as-UPS analysis: capacity sizing and functionality
Notes_Comments: BESS vs UPS under review
Cost Impact: BESS-as-UPS rejected. Traditional 2N UPS: $26.3M total phased CAPEX (Phase 1: $4.5M)

Action Description: Confirm building test fit on site and equipment yard locations
Notes_Comments: Test fit building configuration on the 121-acre site to determine optimal orientation. Once building is placed, determine which side is appropriate for generator yard and which side for chiller yard (north/south/east/west). Consider factors: property lines, access roads, future expansion areas, sound attenuation, prevailing winds. Replaces assumption of north side for generators - need to validate building placement first.
Cost Impact: Site layout and sound attenuation requirements ($200-400K)
Timeline Impact: Equipment access and future phase expansion planning

Action Description: Confirm electrical room configuration (indoor vs outdoor)
Notes_Comments: BOD shows reversion to traditional indoor electrical rooms (6,000 SF total, 2√ó 3,000 SF) to house 2N UPS systems. October architectural meeting discussed outdoor containerized enclosures. Confirm final approach and resolve discrepancy. Traditional UPS requires indoor housing with fire suppression and cooling (outdoor only viable with BESS-as-UPS, which is rejected).
Cost Impact: $2-3M for indoor electrical rooms (fire suppression, cooling)

Action Description: Validate sizing for liquid-cooled AI racks
Notes_Comments: Confirm 9√ó MCDU-50 equivalent units (or similar) are adequate for 48 AI racks (up to 132 kW/rack liquid-cooled). Validate chilled water manifold distribution and leak detection strategy. Direct-to-chip vs rear-door liquid coil options for customers.
Cost Impact: $500K-1M CDU CAPEX

Action Description: Research GCP Cloud Interconnect requirements (if Camelot doesn't cover)
Notes_Comments: Only if not in Camelot scope, and determine if telecom consultant is needed to engage. Coordinate with Aaron's Google outreach.

Action Description: Provide CapEx difference and efficiency comparison for closed-loop cooling
Notes_Comments: Sustainability vs efficiency trade-off. Validate zero water cooling strategy cost delta. CAPEX/OPEX / Total Cost of Ownership analysis. Use note: Packaged air cooled chiller with a free cooling coil. When you don't need mech cooling you just pull the cold air across.
Cost Impact: TBD

Action Description: Design for incremental RDHx deployment with base chilled water loop
Notes_Comments: Validate rear-door heat exchanger (RDHx) deployment for racks and confirm costs for financial model.
Cost Impact: +$144-240K RDHx CAPEX, but provides flexible billing

Action Description: Financial Model: Review power pass-through model and IRR calculations with consultant
Notes_Comments: Look for IRR increase from traditional all-in pricing to power pass-through model. Removes commodity risk from operator.
Cost Impact: IRR increase from 12.1% to 15-19%

Action Description: Finalize chiller plant sizing and cooling strategy
Notes_Comments: Confirm chiller count and sizing for 12 MW initial (20-24 MW ultimate) capacity. Current plan: ~16 air-cooled chillers @ 1.5 MW each in modular 3 MW blocks (3 chillers per block = N+1 redundancy). Validate against PUE target (1.2-1.3) and Oklahoma climate (~215 days/year free cooling). Air-cooled with integrated free cooling confirmed, adiabatic coolers eliminated (zero water cooling strategy). Closed-loop system analysis. Review free cooling hour curves for Tulsa climate.
Cost Impact: $8-12M phased chiller CAPEX, +$150-450K net vs adiabatic coolers

Action Description: Confirm diverse fiber routes to Google Pryor campus (4 miles away)
Notes_Comments: Part of Camelot fiber study scope (Task 3). Coordinate with 27-001 and 27-002. Client SOW indicates: 'Site Resources: - Proximity to fiber and water for the site - Fiber information (requested by Client via email)'

Action Description: Confirm UPS equipment specifications and pricing
Notes_Comments: Select traditional 2N modular UPS equipment specifications for Phase 1 deployment (6MW N+1, $4.5M). Lock pricing for future phase expansions (ultimate 28MW, $26.3M total phased). Confirm modular frame sizing and spare parts compatibility. This is for design and cost estimating, not vendor selection/procurement. Can likely use existing Schneider estimates, but should confirm.
Cost Impact: $4.5M Phase 1 CAPEX (Class 3 estimate +/- 15-20%)

Action Description: Confirm final generator configuration (turbine + diesel mix)
Notes_Comments: Based on natural gas service confirmation (33-002) and turbine lead time research (99-002), finalize generator count and fuel mix. Current plan: 4-5 generators total (natural gas turbine + diesel recip mix, N+1 redundancy). Consider customer preference for fuel diversity. Phase 1: 2√ó generators (N+1) for $2.4M, ultimate: 8√ó generators for $10.8M total phased.
Cost Impact: $2.4M Phase 1 CAPEX, ¬±$500K-$1M based on turbine vs diesel mix

Action Description: Finance Model: Update total project CAPEX range (Phase 1 and Ultimate)
Notes_Comments: Review cost tables at the end of each BOD division page. Consolidate all BOD updates into revised total project cost estimate. Provide Phase 1 CAPEX (initial 12 MW deployment) and ultimate CAPEX (20-24 MW with all phases). Update financial model with revised assumptions: traditional UPS phasing ($4.5M Phase 1 vs $26.3M total), chiller expansion (~16 chillers, $8-12M phased), BESS elimination savings, raised floor elimination ($900K-$1.25M savings), etc. Accuracy: Class 3 (+/- 15-20%).
Cost Impact: Phase 1 and ultimate CAPEX baseline for financial model and investor materials

Action Description: Research demand response programs and incentive structure
Notes_Comments: Determine if facility qualifies for OG&E Load Reduction Program; assess revenue opportunity ($600k/year potential with natural gas turbine generators at zero incremental CAPEX). Document why generators provide demand response capability, eliminating need for Economic BESS (which has negative NPV).
Cost Impact: $600k/year revenue with generators

Action Description: Evaluate roof type upgrade for wind/missile resistance
Notes_Comments: FM I-135 compliance. Compare to ASCE wind map requirements for Tulsa region to determine appropriate wind resistance standard.
Cost Impact: TBD

Action Description: Validate substation transformer sizing (15-20 MVA)
Notes_Comments: Confirm 15-20 MVA sizing is adequate for facility load without BESS (12 MW IT + mechanical/support, PUE 1.2-1.3 = ~15 MW peak). Original 20-25 MVA estimate included BESS charging load (now eliminated). Coordinate with 33-001 utility interconnection study results. Official Transformer sizing shall be 20/16/12 MVA ONAN/ONAF1/ONAF2 138kV-34.5kV 13.2kv TERT.
Cost Impact: $400-800K if customer-owned transformer, ¬±$100-200K based on sizing

Action Description: Validate slab-on-grade can support equipment loads
Notes_Comments: Review geotechnical analysis to confirm slab-on-grade can support equipment loads (chillers, transformers, generators) without raised floor. Raised floor eliminated from design ($900K-$1.25M savings). After geotechnical review.
Cost Impact: $900K-$1.25M savings (raised floor elimination)

Action Description: PGCIS to review geotech analysis for design implications
Notes_Comments: Review for foundation design and site grading requirements. Coordinate with 02-002 (slab-on-grade validation).

Action Description: Get Generac lead time quotes for diesel generators
Notes_Comments: Compare to turbine lead times (1yr). Part of generator fuel strategy decision. Including in work with Constructiv.
Cost Impact: $0.5M-$1M slip cost if delayed

Action Description: Complete water and wastewater availability study
Notes_Comments: Confirm municipal water service availability (500-1,000 gal/day domestic use only - zero water cooling strategy) and sanitary sewer capacity. Or septic. If municipal unavailable, evaluate on-site well/septic system design per Oklahoma DEQ requirements. If not closed-loop cooling: $5K-$15K study cost.
Cost Impact: $50-200K connection fees (municipal) or $100-300K (on-site well/septic), plus $5K-$15K study
Timeline Impact: Potential for expensive utility extensions if municipal unavailable

Action Description: Confirm diesel fuel storage strategy (if diesel generators selected)
Notes_Comments: Finalize diesel fuel storage approach: sub-base belly tanks vs centralized above-ground storage tank (AST). Confirm 48-hour minimum runtime capacity and EPA SPCC plan requirements (if >1,320 gallons total). Coordinate with final generator configuration (48-001).
Cost Impact: $200-400K fuel storage CAPEX + EPA SPCC compliance

Action Description: Confirm rooftop AHU configuration for data hall humidity control
Notes_Comments: Validate rooftop AHU sizing for 40,000 SF data hall (Phase 1: 20,000 SF fitted, Phase 2: 20,000 SF shell). Confirm N+1 redundancy and integration with RDHx/CDU cooling strategy. AHUs handle humidity control + building over-pressurization, not IT heat rejection. Deviation from RD109 baseline (adds comfort cooling not in original scope).
Cost Impact: $300-500K CAPEX
